title: How to Make a New Year Card

steps.headline: Fold a piece of cardstock in half to create the card.
steps.description: Choose a piece of lightweight cardstock in your desired colour. Then, fold it in half lengthwise or widthwise. To make a typical size greeting card, use a 10 inches (25 cm) x 14 inches (36 cm) piece of cardstock. If you opt for a dark piece of cardstock, you will need a white or silver pen to write in the card. Lightweight cardstock works best, as heavy cardstock is harder to fold.

steps.headline: Write “Happy New Year” or the number of the year on the front of the card.
steps.description: This helps to give your card a festive feel that's specific to the season. Write the text in calligraphy or decorative lettering, and use a gel pen or ink marker to make your text stand out from the card. “All the best for the New Year” and “Here's to a New Year” are other possible phrases you could use. Alternatively, cut your letters or numbers out from a patterned piece of paper and stick them to your card.

steps.headline: Glue a photo in the middle of your card if you want to share family memories.
steps.description: This is a great way to personalise your card. Print out a family photo and stick it onto your card with hot glue. You could also print out a picture of your family pet or a favourite vacation photo. Be creative and express your unique style. If you don't have hot glue, use double-sided tape instead.

steps.headline: Use glitter if you wish to capture the festive spirit of the season.
steps.description: Use glitter or sequins to create a border around your card. Alternatively, use the glitter or sequins to create a pattern on the card. This helps to give your card a bright and festive look. Place a thin layer of glue where you want the glitter and then sprinkle the sequins or glitter evenly over the area. A personal photo stuck on a card with a sequin border would look striking. For a simple but effective option, make a fireworks pattern with hot glue and then sprinkle glitter over it. This is a great on-theme look! To create a geometric look, stick sequins on your card in a geometric pattern, such as zig-zags or hexagons.

steps.headline: Place a pop-up inside the card if you want a fun, surprising option.
steps.description: Pop-ups are perfect for New Years' cards! Place a happy New Year message on the pop-up or attach a New Years' themed decoration, such as a picture of fireworks or champagne. Use double-sided tape to attach the decorations to the pop-up. These cards are a great option for kids!

steps.headline: Write a handwritten New Years' message inside the card.
steps.description: A New Years' card is the perfect opportunity to wish the recipient all the best for the year to come. It can also be a great way to share any updates from the year and to let them know your plans for the year to come. If you prefer not to write by hand, type your message on the computer, print it out, and then stick it inside the card. For example, “We wish you a wonderful year to come. Looking to the year ahead, Jake is starting school and Ryan will start Grade 6. John and I are continuing our current jobs and are looking forward to a trip to Hawaii in April. Hope all is well with you and the family. Hope to see you all soon. Much love!”

steps.headline: Choose a card template on an online card design site.
steps.description: Search online for a site where you can design custom greeting cards. There are a multitude of free sites as well as paid options. Scroll through the different templates and select the one that you like best. https://www.canva.com, https://www.greetingsisland.com/cards, and https://www.befunky.com/features/card-maker/ all have great New Year card templates.

steps.headline: Upload an image for a personal touch.
steps.description: If you want to add a family photo or a picture that you have taken, click the camera button and upload your photo. Use the cursor to increase or decrease the size of the image to fit the card. Use the filter toolbar to vary the look of the image with filters, such as black and white or high saturation. Firework pictures are a great option for New Years' cards.

steps.headline: Type a New Years' wish onto the card.
steps.description: Click on the text section to add your own New Years' message. If there isn't enough space to write your entire message, simply select a smaller text size. Make sure to sign off with your name so the recipient knows who the card is from. Aim to make your font at least 8 pt so that it is easy to read.

steps.headline: Print the card or send it via email.
steps.description: If you want to send the card online, click send and then enter the receivers email address. If you want to send the card via mail, press download and then print it out. Make sure to send your card before Christmas, as mail tends to be delayed around New Years'. Use light-weight paper and 10 inches (25 cm) x 14 inches (36 cm) envelopes. If you would prefer not to print the card yourself, use an online printing service to print and ship the card for you.
